intro: Macrocentrum andinum, commonly known as the Andean macrocentrum, is a flowering plant native to the high Andes of South America. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, feathery leaves. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in mountainous regions with well-drained soil. Due to its unique appearance and ecological significance, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
